title: On eve of first launch, Relativity Space seeks to join SpaceX as “disruptor”
summary: "Almost from the beginning of the company, I wanted to build a Falcon 9 competitor."

title: Terran 1 and Terran R testing in full swing before Relativity’s debut
summary: The first fully integrated static fire test of Relativity Space’s Terran 1 rocket is expected any day now as the company prepares for its first-ever launch from Florida. Following a series of tests of the rocket’s first stage, the second stage and nosecone were assembled, and the entire vehicle has now rolled back to the pad on the transporter/erector.

title: Relativity Space sets date for first Terran 1 launch
summary: Relativity Space announced Feb. 22 it will attempt the first launch of its Terran 1 rocket as soon as March 8 after securing a launch license and skipping a planned final test.

title: Relativity Receives Launch Licence, Sets Launch Date
summary: On 21 February 2023, the FAA granted Relativity Space a launch licence for the first launch of their Terran 1 rocket. The issued launch licence authorises Relativity to conduct pre-launch operations and launch operations at SLC-16. Since Relativity Space recieved its launch licence they have announced the launch date for the ‘Good Luck Have Fun’ (GLHF) mission, between 13:00-16:00 EST (18:00-21:00 UTC) on 8 March 2023.

title: Relativity sets launch date for first flight of Terran 1 rocket
summary: Relativity Space plans to skip a final test-firing of its first fully stacked Terran 1 rocket at Cape Canaveral and proceed with a launch attempt March 8 for the methane-fueled, 3D-printed launcher, the company said Wednesday.

title: Rocket Report: SpaceX may see revenue spike in 2023; Terran 1 gets a date
summary: “Each Artemis mission will be properly characterized as a test mission."

title: Relativity Space ready to launch 3D-printed, methane-fueled orbital rocket
summary: Relativity Space, a California-based startup that counts billionaire Mark Cuban as one of its early investors, is ready to launch the first 3D-printed, methane-fueled rocket into orbit from Cape Canaveral.

title: Launch day timeline for Relativity Space’s Terran 1 rocket
summary: Relativity Space’s 10-story-tall Terran 1 rocket will encounter the most extreme aerodynamic forces of its eight-minute test flight around 80 seconds after liftoff from Cape Canaveral. That’s a key moment when the company’s engineers hope to confirm the 3D-printed rocket can withstand the rigors of launch.

title: Relativity Space scrubs maiden launch of Terran 1 rocket
summary: Relativity Space scrubbed the first launch of its Terran 1 rocket Wednesday, in an attempt to become the first 3D-printed and methane-fueled rocket to reach orbit. The Good Luck, Have Fun (GLHF) mission was scheduled for liftoff from Launch Complex 16 (LC-16) at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station during a three-hour launch window opening at 1 PM EST (18:00 UTC).

title: Relativity Space scrubs first attempt to launch Terran 1 [Updated]
summary: Relativity Space is one of the more intriguing new space launch companies.

title: Relativity postpones first launch attempt of 3D-printed rocket Terran 1
summary: 3D-printing specialist Relativity Space postponed its first launch attempt on Wednesday, a mission that marks the most significant test yet of the company’s ambitious manufacturing approach.

title: Relativity Space Scrubs Maiden Flight Of Terran 1 Rocket
summary: On 8th March 2023, Relativity Space scrubbed the Good Luck Have Fun (GLHF) launch due to exceeding launch commit criteria levels for the thermal conditions of Stage 2.

title: Relativity Space scrubs first Terran 1 launch attempt
summary: Relativity Space will wait at least three days before making its next attempt to launch its Terran 1 rocket after propellant temperature issues scrubbed its first launch attempt March 8.
